TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed CapStyle extends System.Enum

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle AllCap = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is all caps; all lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle AllPetiteCaps = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is all petite caps; uppercase and lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters slightly smaller than small caps.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that there is no capitalization style; uppercase and lowercase letters render normally.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle Other = int32(-1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is a style not explicitly specified in the CapStyle enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle PetiteCaps = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is petite caps; lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters slightly smaller than small caps.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle SmallCap = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is small caps; lowercase letters are replaced with uppercase letters of the same approximate height as the font's x-height.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle Titling = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is title case; uppercase and lowercase letters are rendered with letters specifically designed for titles.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Text.CapStyle Unicase = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the capitalization style is unicase; uppercase and lowercase letters are rendered in a way determined by the type designer. A unicase alphabet is one that does not specify case for its letters.
